column1: 2 ^ Exáŭdiat te Dòminus in die tribulatiónis~; prótegat te nomen Dei Jacóbis. ^ May the Lord hear thee in the day of tribulation~; may the name of the God of Jacob protect thee.

column2: et de Sióne tueátur te. ^ May he send thee help from the sanctuary
column3: and defend thee out of Sion.

column2: et holocáŭstum tuum pingŭe fiat. ^ May he be mindful of all thy sacrifices
column3: and may thy whole burntoffering be made fat.

column2: et omne consìlium tuum confìrmet. ^ May he give thee according to thy own heart
et in nómine Dei nostri magnificábimur. ^ We will rejoice in thy salvation
column3: and in the name of our God we shall be exalted.

column1: 7 ^ Ìmpleat Dòminus òmnes petitiónes tuas~; nunc cognóvi qŭóniam salvum fecit Dòminus christum suum. Exáŭdiet illum de caĕlo sancto suo~; in potentátibus salûs dèxteraĕ ejus. ^ The Lord fulfil all thy petitions
column2: now have I known that the Lord hath saved his anointed. He will hear him from his holy heaven~; the salvation of his right hand is in powers.
et hi in èqŭîs~; nos aŭtem in nómine Dòmini Dei nostri invocábimus. ^ Some trust in chariots
column3: and some in horses~; but we will call upon the name of the Lord

column2: et cecidérunt~; nos aŭtem surréximus et erécti sùmus. ^ They are bound
et exáŭdi nos in die qua invocavèrimus te. ^ O Lord
column4: and hear us in the day that we shall call upon thee.
